      • fetchVerifyingPublicKeysWith

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public RewardedAdsVerifier.Builder fetchVerifyingPublicKeysWith​(com.google.crypto.tink.apps.rewardedads.KeysDownloader downloader)
                                                         throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Fetches verifying public keys of the sender using KeysDownloader.

        This is the preferred method of specifying the verifying public keys.

        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException

      • setVerifyingPublicKeys

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public RewardedAdsVerifier.Builder setVerifyingPublicKeys​(java.lang.String publicKeysJson)
                                                   throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Sets the trusted verifying public keys of the sender.

        IMPORTANT: Instead of using this method to set the verifying public keys of the sender, prefer calling fetchVerifyingPublicKeysWith(com.google.crypto.tink.apps.rewardedads.KeysDownloader) passing it an instance of KeysDownloader. It will take care of fetching fresh keys and caching in memory. Only use this method if you can't use fetchVerifyingPublicKeysWith(com.google.crypto.tink.apps.rewardedads.KeysDownloader) and be aware you will need to handle key rotations yourself.

        The given string is a JSON object formatted like the following: 

         {
   "keys": [
     {
       keyId: 1916455855,
       pem: "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\nMFkwEwYHKoZIzj0CAQYIKoZIzj0DAQcDQgAEUaWMKcBHWdhUE+DncSIHhFCLLEln\nUs0LB9oanZ4K/FNICIM8ltS4nzc9yjmhgVQOlmSS6unqvN9t8sqajRTPcw==\n-----END PUBLIC KEY-----"
       base64: "MFkwEwYHKoZIzj0CAQYIKoZIzj0DAQcDQgAEUaWMKcBHWdhUE+DncSIHhFCLLElnUs0LB9oanZ4K/FNICIM8ltS4nzc9yjmhgVQOlmSS6unqvN9t8sqajRTPcw=="
     },
     {
       keyId: 3901585526,
       pem: "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\nMFYwEAYHKoZIzj0CAQYFK4EEAAoDQgAEtxg2BsK/fllIeADtLspezS6YfHFWXZ8tiJncm8LDBa/NxEC84akdWbWDCUrMMGIV27/3/e7UuKSEonjGvaDUsw==\n-----END PUBLIC KEY-----"
       base64: "MFYwEAYHKoZIzj0CAQYFK4EEAAoDQgAEtxg2BsK/fllIeADtLspezS6YfHFWXZ8tiJncm8LDBa/NxEC84akdWbWDCUrMMGIV27/3/e7UuKSEonjGvaDUsw=="
     },
   ],
 }

        Each public key will be a base64 (no wrapping, padded) version of the key encoded in ASN.1 type SubjectPublicKeyInfo defined in the X.509 standard.

        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException

      • addVerifyingPublicKey

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public RewardedAdsVerifier.Builder addVerifyingPublicKey​(long keyId,
                                                         java.lang.String val)
                                                  throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Adds a verifying public key of the sender.

        IMPORTANT: Instead of using this method to set the verifying public keys of the sender, prefer calling fetchVerifyingPublicKeysWith(com.google.crypto.tink.apps.rewardedads.KeysDownloader) passing it an instance of KeysDownloader. It will take care of fetching fresh keys and caching in memory. Only use this method if you can't use fetchVerifyingPublicKeysWith(com.google.crypto.tink.apps.rewardedads.KeysDownloader) and be aware you will need to handle Google key rotations yourself.

        The public key is a base64 (no wrapping, padded) version of the key encoded in ASN.1 type SubjectPublicKeyInfo defined in the X.509 standard.

        Multiple keys may be added. This utility will then verify any message signed with any of the private keys corresponding to the public keys added. Adding multiple keys is useful for handling key rotation.

        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException

      • addVerifyingPublicKey

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public RewardedAdsVerifier.Builder addVerifyingPublicKey​(long keyId,
                                                         java.security.interfaces.ECPublicKey val)
                                                  throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Adds a verifying public key of the sender.

        IMPORTANT: Instead of using this method to set the verifying public keys of the sender, prefer calling fetchVerifyingPublicKeysWith(com.google.crypto.tink.apps.rewardedads.KeysDownloader) passing it an instance of KeysDownloader. It will take care of fetching fresh keys and caching in memory. Only use this method if you can't use fetchVerifyingPublicKeysWith(com.google.crypto.tink.apps.rewardedads.KeysDownloader) and be aware you will need to handle Google key rotations yourself.

        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException
